main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted by a civilian airport manager near Gadsden, Alabama on January 11, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as round or oval in shape, approximately 30-40 feet in diameter.
The object made a rapid climb and then leveled off, emitting a bright light that illuminated the area.
The object had a metallic or aluminum-like surface that reflected sunlight and was surrounded by a vapor trail.
The object was observed to move at a high rate of speed.
The weather was clear and visibility was good, with no other air traffic in the location at the time.
sighted object: a round or oval-shaped unidentified flying object
